title: Highlights and Trends from the Fashion Awards
summary: The Fashion Awards, held at London's Royal Albert Hall, brought together designers, models, and celebrities for an evening celebrating fashion excellence. Notable moments included singers Ellie Goulding and actress Sienna Miller revealing their pregnancies on a blue carpet, a departure from the traditional red, chosen by the British Fashion Council. Awards were presented to key figures: Jonathan Anderson of Dior as designer of the year, Grace Wales Bonner for British menswear designer, Sarah Burton of Givenchy for British womenswear designer, and Anok Yai as model of the year, who delivered an empowering message about diversity. The event featured a performance by singer Raye and highlighted current fashion trends, such as 'country-coded' clothing gaining popularity in the UK. Additionally, the article touches on broader fashion industry issues, including criticism of AI-generated advertisements by a luxury brand and accusations of malpractice by US politicians. Overall, it provides a snapshot of the awards while connecting to larger themes in fashion.
